DJ Fujimaru 20:00 - 21:30
DJ Vulp 21:30 - 23:00
Seeker 23:00 - 00:00

schedule.title: QC Furries & Kinksters Meetup
schedule.description: DEFCON Furs is back again hosting this Queercon event, providing a safe space where the community can meet up and share adult interests. The event is open to all genders and orientations who have an interest in furry, puppy, kink, alternative, queer, ect... Come join us to party and meet old friends and make new ones. Open to all with a Queercon pass. Cash Bar.

schedule.title: DEFCON Pups Meet & Greet
schedule.description: Grab your hoods, socialize with other pups, and enjoy some drinks from the cash bar at the first event hosted by DEFCON Pups! Pup hoods optional, bio dogs not permitted. No mosh at this event. Open to all with a Queercon pass. Cash Bar.

schedule.title: Beyond Binaries Mixer
schedule.description: Please join us for DEFCON Furs's first non-binary gender identity mixer. There are not a lot of safe spaces for transgender/genderqueer individuals to meet and socialize at DEF CON, so we've taken the liberty of creating one. Are you a transgender/non-binary/gender non-conforming hacker? Come meet, connect, and form lasting friendships. There will be no gender policing here and you are free to express yourself, as yourself, in our company! Open to all with a Queercon pass. Cash Bar.

schedule.title: Using Error Budgets to Expand Your Comfort Zone
schedule.description:
Error Budgets are a mechanism Site Reliability Engineers use to enable teams to embrace risk while ensuring reliability targets (SLAs) won't be missed. In this talk, I will demonstrate how I've used Error Budgets in social contexts to expand my comfort zone and foster growth toward the creature I wish to be. I will discuss the process of creating "Interpersonal SLAs" with friends, colleagues, and the general public; how to measure performance and feedback; and how to apply SRE methodologies to all aspects of these endeavors.
Open to all with a Queercon pass.

schedule.title: Building The DEFCON Furs 2019 Badge
schedule.description:
"Modern SMT Circuit Board Assembly And Manufacturing - Building The DefCon Furs Badge" presenting the entire automated PCB assembly process and Q&A. This presentation will include pictures, video, alcohol (for the presenter), and all sorts of interesting and random trivia regarding the mechanics and physics of the SMT line assembly process as well as the high-tech 3D metrology used to verify solder paste prints and final assembled boards. If you design or intend to design circuit boards for manufacture this is a great way to understand what happens at the assembly house and what little things you can do with your design that will make your assembly house either love or hate you!
Open to all with a Queercon pass.

schedule.title: Effective Technical Presentations
schedule.description: Avoiding death by Powerpoint. Open to all with a Queercon pass.

schedule.title: DEFCON Pups - Doggy Paddle
schedule.description: By popular demand!! Come join use for a doggy paddle around at the pool in the Alexis Park. Hoods encouraged. Even if you dont want to swim. Open to public - no badge required.

schedule.title: Gender Fluidity in the BDSM Community
schedule.description:
BDSM is stereotyped as being hyperfocused on sex, but the community is about much more than that. The BDSM community supports everyone in living authentically. Come learn about a space where you can find support in learning about yourself and receive guidance in walking your unique path.

Open to all with a Queercon pass.

schedule.title: DEFCON Pups 101
schedule.description: New to the pup and handler space? Want to learn what human pup play means to different people? Come join us for a chat and to hear different perspectives from various people involved in the PAH (pups and handler) space. Open to all with a Queercon pass. Cash Bar.

schedule.title: DEFCON Pups Mosh & Social
schedule.description: Come join our Mosh - be it your first or 100th, we would love to see you there to connect with other pups, handlers and those still curious. We will have a mosh mat setup; so bring your pup gear and *soft* toys (sorry no toys that could damage teeth or equipment). We look forward to seeing you there (for some ruff'n'tumble or just socializing and sharing a drink). Open to all with a Queercon pass. Cash Bar.

schedule.title: Mind Games: Exploring Mental Health through Games
schedule.description:
Mental health is a serious topic in our community. Many people in the tech industry as a whole and specifically within the security community suffer from mental issues, but unfortunately for all of the awareness efforts it can still be very difficult to properly express what experiencing mental illness is like in a safe manner. Games are an excellent if unconventional tool to bridge this gap and gain a better understanding of what a sufferer experiences with a range of conditions. This talk discusses three mental conditions: depression, ADHD, and PTSD. The games chosen each illustrate gameplay, narrative, and symbolism consistent with the conditions they are associated with.
Open to all with a Queercon pass.

schedule.title: Hack Your Palate: An Introduction to the World of Scotch Whisk(e)y (21+ only)
schedule.description:
Whiskey or Whisky - Single Malt or Blended - Speyside, Highland, Campbeltown, Islay, or something else, the world of Scotch Whsk(e)y can be a confusing place.

Since the value of ethanol was discovered by early man, alcohol has shared our history. During this panel we will explore the world of Scotch Whisk(e)y. We will explain the lingo, talk about the history and culture, explore the varieties of Scotch. Talk about how this magical drink is produced and maybe even share a dram or two.

Newbies and experienced aficionados are welcome. Open to all with a Queercon pass. (limited admission: only will be 25 admitted)

schedule.title: Closing Ceremony
schedule.description: Closing ceremony for DEFCON Furs. Come hear how things went, give us feedback, and maybe catch some of our future plans. Open to all.

schedule.title: DEFCON Pups - Pups and Handlers Swim
schedule.description: Following the closing ceromony, come join use for a doggy paddle around at the pool in the Alexis Park. Hoods encouraged. Even if you dont want to swim, its a chance to reconnect with folks before the conference fully ends. Open to public - no badge required.

schedule.title: DEFCON Badge Pickup (Presales only)
schedule.description: Pick up your donor swag!
